title: Johnston County Hams Recalls Ready-To-Eat Ham Products Due to Possible Listeria Contamination
summary: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3, 2018 Johnston County Hams, a Smithfield, N.C. establishment, is recalling approximately 89,096 pounds of ready-to-eat ham products that may be adulterated with Listeria monocytogenes, the U.S. Department of Agricultures Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. The ready-to-eat deli-loaf ham items...
